Alasdair Monk

Digital Product Designer & Developer

Today, I'm a UX Architect at Salesforce working on our Heroku product and towards making developer experiences better.

Prior to this, I was the Head of Design at GoCardless where I worked for three years on democratising payments for small businesses.

I'm keenly interested in the intersection of design & code and most of my writing reflects this. I like big ideas and hard projects and making something from nothing.

Selected Writing

  • Designing & building our design toolchain

    An overview of design tooling that we've built at Heroku and how it's impacted our productivity for the better

  • Blame your tools

    What's wrong with our design tooling and how is it holding us back? Commissioned by and originally published in net Magazine

  • Making remote work

    What we've learnt about what works and what doesn't when working remotely

  • Building an experimental design tool

    The introductory post to a side project of mine called Bind, which was an experimental design tool based around the idea of using constraints as the primary layout driver

  • How a sketch on a napkin changed how the world thought about architecture

    The Crystal Palace of Hyde Park in 1851 was a wonder of the Victorian era, but it almost never happened. Adapted from a presentation I gave at General Assembly’s Design Night Marathon on the subject of "things you didn’t know about design"

Selected Projects

  • Pylon

    A CSS library of declarative layout primitives

  • Lampon Lets

    Web build and branding for this independent Letting Agent in East Sussex

  • Botframe

    A little tool to help design conversational interfaces. Built with Ember and Parse

  • Bind

    An experimental design tool that I designed and developed. Hybrid React and Cocoa Objective C app

  • Shrink

    A macOS app for keeping track of GitHub issues. Built with Electron and Ember
